column5: Hi Guys/Gals  I spoke with our Lodge on Callandar Bay last nite.  Thier huts went out on Tuesday afternoon on 10 1/2 inches of ice.  Been really cold ever since.  On an interesting note.  All minnows used to be included in the packages offered.  Now with the ban on importing non-native minnows to Nip, some of the outfitters are charging $5.00/doz.  Which is their apparent cost.  Not that this would change any trip plans, just letting you know there may be added costs this year.  Regards
I've heard 5.00 a dozen as well.  Only really a 1.00 jump, not huge, but not convenient.
$5 a dozen wow!  I would be bringing alternative baits if i could this year.  Good luck i to heard 10 inches and getting thicker as well!  Cheers!
Last year we brought up a few dozen maggots, we slaughtered the herring and perch on them, even got a few nice whities !!  Their not expensive either.
